pullRequest.title: Make sure `containerCap` defaults to Integer.MAX_VALUE when starting from an empty `KubernetesCloud`

commit.message: Make sure containerCap defaults to Integer.MAX_VALUE when starting from an empty KubernetesCloud

nodes.bodyText: Was this not setting the default value properly? AFAICT it hasn't defaulted to 0 since 5 years ago.
Instance initializers are not run during deserialization, so the field would have been left at its Java primitive default of 0.

Prefer

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                private Integer containerCap = Integer.MAX_VALUE;
          
          
            
                private Integer containerCap;
          
      
    
    
  

revert the patch to readResolve and change the getter to return
containerCap != null ? containerCap ? Integer.MAX_VALUE
to avoid gratuitously serializing an ugly value from an unconfigured field. (You will anyway once someone saves the cloud, unless you also null out the default from the getter.)

IIUC we need a readResolve which sets 0 (old "unlimited") to null (new "unlimited").
Once null, the getter will convert null to Integer.MAX_VALUE.
Correct?
